thanks for the appreciation, my friend. i will try to help you with your problem. i don't know if this will work on mac, but let's try. there is a software called Any Video Converter. you can use it to convert any video file to any format, but be sure to use the right settings (to be sure, use "Original" in frame size, bitrate etc.) and i think that will solve the lagging. if not, it's time for that much needed upgrade, and i recommend a PC. and just so you know, mkv rules the 21st century right now. keep up and good luck!
and thanks again for the appreciation, it's good to know my work is not in vain.

Hey murdoc I love your torrents except that when you try to make them an avchd the size is too big for a DVD5. anyway around this?
m2ts (avchd) adds on a few megabytes, so you go over the dvd5 limit. a way around this is to simply burn it this way and use an mkv compatible decoder on your tv. nowadays they're built-in.
